intro: Androcalva incilis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sand thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Androcalva incilis is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
